revised_title: Exploring the Relationship between Shape and Fine Structure in Drosophila Melanogaster Bristles
tldr: The authors studied the shape and fine structure of bristles in Drosophila melanogaster, focusing on the relationship between bristle shape and the orientation of chitin molecules in the cell wall. They found a close correspondence between shape and orientation in both normal and mutant bristles, and suggested that bristle shape is influenced by factors related to the growth of chitin chains and the substances secreted by the trichogen cells.
scientific_discipline: Biology and Life Sciences > Developmental Biology
